author: achaldhillon
title: Artist of the day 22/03: Blanco White
text:
(Picture: Blanco White) Metro.co.uk and record label Killing Moon pick out the new artists you should listen to today. 
Mariah Carey cashes in on All I Want For Christmas Is You again with new movie Blanco White sounds like : Your first go doing a bit of flamenco dancing in Barcelona at sunrise and somehow you are legit good at it.
Similar artists : Mumford & Sons, Gypsy Kings, Calexico
His story : Blanco White is the band-name moniker for Londoner Josh Edwards, who began his musical career in 2014.
His heavy Latin music influences began with his studying of Spanish guitar in Cadiz then an Andean instrument called a charango whilst hanging out in Bolivia.
He then spliced these elements together with contemporary acoustic rock music to cement his rather unique take on international folk music.
Last year, he released his debut EP entitled The Wind Rose on rising influential indie Yucatan Records
What’s so great about him? Acoustic guitar-based music isn’t easy to render particularly unique, however given the obvious Latin undertones to his music, Blanco White appears to succeed rather well in exactly that.
Coupled with powerful-yet-gentle vocals that send the listener on a holiday very much on their own, it’s no surprise that Blanco White is steadily getting picked up by every mood-based Spotify playlist going.
Music licensing departments would likely dub this guy an absolute goldmine.
Most-streamed track on Spotify : Chalk (over 1.2M listens so far)
Most-recent video :

 
What will he be doing in 2017 ? Mr White has, as mentioned above, caused quite the stir in certain folk/pop circles courtesy of his atmospheric Latin-tinged tones.
Given the first EP went so well, he figured another EP would probably be a smart move and this time has enlisted the involvement of long-time Communion Music producer type Ian Grimble, noted for his recent work with the likes of Bear’s Den, Matt Corby and Daughter.
The EP was recorded at the end of last year and is due out for release at the end of this month.
More: Music Listen to Chuck Berry's new single Big Boys as details of his last album emerge 
Artist of the day 21/03: Veridian 
Louisa Johnson's new music video is basically a mini Coachella 
Signed to : Yucatan Records
Upcoming live dates :
28 March: Sofar Sounds, London 29 March: The Troubadour, London
